titleInfo.title: The Welfare Reform Debate: Implications for Child Care

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This paper is intended to help child care advocates think about the many difficult and painful issues that could be raised if a state proposes to revamp its current child care system. The document should be viewed as a work in progress because of the uncertainty about the outcome of federal proposals. The paper reemphasizes CDF's stance on opposing any legislation that would significantly increase the need for child care assistance for welfare families without providing sufficient funding to meet the demand, that would jeopardize child care assistance for poor working families, or that would jeopardize the quality of child care.
